title: Sci-Tech: 4th China-Arab States Expo in NW China's Ningxia
content:
Never losing a finger-guessing game? Growing vegetables without sunlight made possible? Or printing out a pair of slippers in 30 minutes? Not a problem because our machines are getting cleverer.
YINCHUAN, Sept. 8, 2019 (Xinhua) -- An exhibition of high technologies and equipment is held as part of the fourth China-Arab States Expo in Yinchuan, northwest China's Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. Visitors are exposed to major scientific and technological breakthroughs and state-of-the-art equipment developed by the high-tech sector.
The fourth China-Arab States Expo has helped promote cross-border high-tech exchange and cooperation.
Visitors look at an extravehicular mobility unit (EMU) designed for a taikonaut at the Expo, Sept. 7, 2019. (Xinhua/Feng Kaihua)
Visitors watch an engineer robot doing its work at the Expo, Sept. 6, 2019. (Xinhua/Feng Kaihua)
Photo taken on Sept. 6, 2019 shows a multi-rotor UAV (unmanned aerial vehicle) displayed at the Expo. (Xinhua/Li Mangmang)
People visit an exhibition of high technologies and equipment at the Expo, Sept. 7, 2019. (Xinhua/Feng Kaihua)
Visitors look at a smart agricultural irrigation system based on the Internet of Things (IoT) technology at the Expo, Sept. 5, 2019. (Xinhua/Li Mangmang)
A visitor plays against a computerized opponent powered by 5G technologies in a mini desktop hockey game at the Expo, Sept. 5, 2019. (Xinhua/Li Mangmang)
A visitor tries on a 5G cloud-based virtual reality (VR) device at the Expo, Sept. 6, 2019. (Xinhua/Feng Kaihua)
